name: hcp
description: A Pulumi package for creating and managing HCP cloud resources.
attribution: This Pulumi package is based on the [`hcp` Terraform Provider](https://github.com/hashicorp/terraform-provider-hcp).

clientId.description: The OAuth2 Client ID for API operations.

clientSecret.description: The OAuth2 Client Secret for API operations.

cloudProvider.description: Name of the cloud provider this image is stored-in, if any.

componentType.description: Name of the builder that built this. Ex: 'amazon-ebs.example'.

packerRunUuid.description: Packer generated UUID of this build.

status.description: Status of this build. DONE means that all images tied to this build were successfully built.

updatedAt.description: Time this build was last updated.

provider.description:
The provider type for the hcp package. By default, resources use package-wide configuration
settings, however an explicit `Provider` instance may be created and passed during resource
construction to achieve fine-grained programmatic control over provider settings. See the
[documentation](https://www.pulumi.com/docs/reference/programming-model/#providers) for more information.

clientId.description: The OAuth2 Client ID for API operations.

clientSecret.description: The OAuth2 Client Secret for API operations.

clientId.description: The OAuth2 Client ID for API operations.

clientSecret.description: The OAuth2 Client Secret for API operations.

createdAt.description: The time that the network peering was created.

expiresAt.description:
The time after which the network peering will be considered expired if it hasn't transitioned into `ACCEPTED` or
`ACTIVE` state.

hvnId.description: The ID of the HashiCorp Virtual Network (HVN).

organizationId.description: The ID of the HCP organization where the network peering is located. Always matches the HVN's organization.

peerAccountId.description: The account ID of the peer VPC in AWS.

peerVpcId.description: The ID of the peer VPC in AWS.

peerVpcRegion.description: The region of the peer VPC in AWS.

peeringId.description: The ID of the network peering.

projectId.description: The ID of the HCP project where the network peering is located. Always matches the HVN's project.

providerPeeringId.description: The peering connection ID used by AWS.

selfLink.description: A unique URL identifying the network peering.

peerVpcId.description: The ID of the peer VPC in AWS.

peerVpcRegion.description: The region of the peer VPC in AWS.

peeringId.description: The ID of the network peering.

createdAt.description: The time that the network peering was created.

expiresAt.description:
The time after which the network peering will be considered expired if it hasn't transitioned into `ACCEPTED` or
`ACTIVE` state.

hvnId.description: The ID of the HashiCorp Virtual Network (HVN).

organizationId.description: The ID of the HCP organization where the network peering is located. Always matches the HVN's organization.

peerAccountId.description: The account ID of the peer VPC in AWS.

peerVpcId.description: The ID of the peer VPC in AWS.

peerVpcRegion.description: The region of the peer VPC in AWS.

peeringId.description: The ID of the network peering.

projectId.description: The ID of the HCP project where the network peering is located. Always matches the HVN's project.

providerPeeringId.description: The peering connection ID used by AWS.

selfLink.description: A unique URL identifying the network peering.

createdAt.description: The time that the transit gateway attachment was created.

expiresAt.description:
The time after which the transit gateway attachment will be considered expired if it hasn't transitioned into `ACCEPTED`
or `ACTIVE` state.

hvnId.description: The ID of the HashiCorp Virtual Network (HVN).

organizationId.description: The ID of the HCP organization where the transit gateway attachment is located. Always matches the HVN's organization.

projectId.description: The ID of the HCP project where the transit gateway attachment is located. Always matches the HVN's project.

providerTransitGatewayAttachmentId.description: The transit gateway attachment ID used by AWS.

resourceShareArn.description:
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Resource Share that is needed to grant HCP access to the transit gateway in AWS.
The Resource Share should be associated with the HCP AWS account principal (see
[aws_ram_principal_association](https://registry.terraform.io/providers/hashicorp/aws/latest/docs/resources/ram_principal_association))
and the transit gateway resource (see
[aws_ram_resource_association](https://registry.terraform.io/providers/hashicorp/aws/latest/docs/resources/ram_resource_association))

selfLink.description: A unique URL identifying the transit gateway attachment.

state.description: The state of the transit gateway attachment.

transitGatewayAttachmentId.description: The user-settable name of the transit gateway attachment in HCP.

transitGatewayId.description: The ID of the user-owned transit gateway in AWS. The AWS region of the transit gateway must match the HVN.

hvnId.description: The ID of the HashiCorp Virtual Network (HVN).

resourceShareArn.description:
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Resource Share that is needed to grant HCP access to the transit gateway in AWS.
The Resource Share should be associated with the HCP AWS account principal (see
[aws_ram_principal_association](https://registry.terraform.io/providers/hashicorp/aws/latest/docs/resources/ram_principal_association))
and the transit gateway resource (see
[aws_ram_resource_association](https://registry.terraform.io/providers/hashicorp/aws/latest/docs/resources/ram_resource_association))

transitGatewayAttachmentId.description: The user-settable name of the transit gateway attachment in HCP.

transitGatewayId.description: The ID of the user-owned transit gateway in AWS. The AWS region of the transit gateway must match the HVN.

stateInputs.description: Input properties used for looking up and filtering AwsTransitGatewayAttachment resources.

createdAt.description: The time that the transit gateway attachment was created.

expiresAt.description:
The time after which the transit gateway attachment will be considered expired if it hasn't transitioned into `ACCEPTED`
or `ACTIVE` state.

hvnId.description: The ID of the HashiCorp Virtual Network (HVN).

organizationId.description: The ID of the HCP organization where the transit gateway attachment is located. Always matches the HVN's organization.

projectId.description: The ID of the HCP project where the transit gateway attachment is located. Always matches the HVN's project.

providerTransitGatewayAttachmentId.description: The transit gateway attachment ID used by AWS.

resourceShareArn.description:
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Resource Share that is needed to grant HCP access to the transit gateway in AWS.
The Resource Share should be associated with the HCP AWS account principal (see
[aws_ram_principal_association](https://registry.terraform.io/providers/hashicorp/aws/latest/docs/resources/ram_principal_association))
and the transit gateway resource (see
[aws_ram_resource_association](https://registry.terraform.io/providers/hashicorp/aws/latest/docs/resources/ram_resource_association))

selfLink.description: A unique URL identifying the transit gateway attachment.

state.description: The state of the transit gateway attachment.

transitGatewayAttachmentId.description: The user-settable name of the transit gateway attachment in HCP.

transitGatewayId.description: The ID of the user-owned transit gateway in AWS. The AWS region of the transit gateway must match the HVN.

hcp:index/azurePeeringConnection:AzurePe.description:
> **Note:** This data source is currently in public beta.

The Azure peering connection resource allows you to manage a peering connection between an HVN and a peer Azure VNet.


## Import

# The import ID is {hvn_id}:{peering_id}

```sh
 $ pulumi import hcp:index/azurePeeringConnection:AzurePeeringConnection peer main-hvn:199e7e96-4d5f-4456-91f3-b6cc71f1e561
```

applicationId.description: The ID of the Azure application whose credentials are used to peer the HCP HVN's underlying VNet with the customer VNet.

azurePeeringId.description: The peering connection ID used by Azure.

createdAt.description: The time that the peering connection was created.

expiresAt.description:
The time after which the peering connection will be considered expired if it hasn't transitioned into `ACCEPTED` or
`ACTIVE` state.

hvnLink.description: The `self_link` of the HashiCorp Virtual Network (HVN).

organizationId.description: The ID of the HCP organization where the peering connection is located. Always matches the HVN's organization.

peerResourceGroupName.description: The resource group name of the peer VNet in Azure.

peerSubscriptionId.description: The subscription ID of the peer VNet in Azure.

peerTenantId.description: The tenant ID of the peer VNet in Azure.

peerVnetName.description: The name of the peer VNet in Azure.

peerVnetRegion.description: The region of the peer VNet in Azure.

peeringId.description: The ID of the peering connection.

projectId.description: The ID of the HCP project where the peering connection is located. Always matches the HVN's project.

selfLink.description: A unique URL identifying the peering connection.

hvnLink.description: The `self_link` of the HashiCorp Virtual Network (HVN).

peerResourceGroupName.description: The resource group name of the peer VNet in Azure.

peerSubscriptionId.description: The subscription ID of the peer VNet in Azure.

peerTenantId.description: The tenant ID of the peer VNet in Azure.

peerVnetName.description: The name of the peer VNet in Azure.

peerVnetRegion.description: The region of the peer VNet in Azure.

peeringId.description: The ID of the peering connection.

stateInputs.description: Input properties used for looking up and filtering AzurePeeringConnection resources.

applicationId.description: The ID of the Azure application whose credentials are used to peer the HCP HVN's underlying VNet with the customer VNet.

azurePeeringId.description: The peering connection ID used by Azure.

createdAt.description: The time that the peering connection was created.

expiresAt.description:
The time after which the peering connection will be considered expired if it hasn't transitioned into `ACCEPTED` or
`ACTIVE` state.

hvnLink.description: The `self_link` of the HashiCorp Virtual Network (HVN).

organizationId.description: The ID of the HCP organization where the peering connection is located. Always matches the HVN's organization.

peerResourceGroupName.description: The resource group name of the peer VNet in Azure.

peerSubscriptionId.description: The subscription ID of the peer VNet in Azure.

peerTenantId.description: The tenant ID of the peer VNet in Azure.

peerVnetName.description: The name of the peer VNet in Azure.

peerVnetRegion.description: The region of the peer VNet in Azure.

peeringId.description: The ID of the peering connection.

projectId.description: The ID of the HCP project where the peering connection is located. Always matches the HVN's project.

selfLink.description: A unique URL identifying the peering connection.

autoHvnToHvnPeering.description:
Enables automatic HVN to HVN peering when creating a secondary cluster in a federation. The alternative to using the
auto-accept feature is to create an [`hcp_hvn_peering_connection`](hvn_peering_connection.md) resource that explicitly
defines the HVN resources that are allowed to communicate with each other.

cloudProvider.description: The provider where the HCP Consul cluster is located.

clusterId.description: The ID of the HCP Consul cluster.

connectEnabled.description: Denotes the Consul connect feature should be enabled for this cluster. Default to true.

consulAutomaticUpgrades.description: Denotes that automatic Consul upgrades are enabled.

consulCaFile.description: The cluster CA file encoded as a Base64 string.

consulConfigFile.description: The cluster config encoded as a Base64 string.

consulPrivateEndpointUrl.description: The private URL for the Consul UI.

consulPublicEndpointUrl.description: The public URL for the Consul UI. This will be empty if `public_endpoint` is `false`.

consulRootTokenAccessorId.description:
The accessor ID of the root ACL token that is generated upon cluster creation. If a new root token is generated using
the `hcp_consul_root_token` resource, this field is no longer valid.

consulRootTokenSecretId.description:
The secret ID of the root ACL token that is generated upon cluster creation. If a new root token is generated using the
`hcp_consul_root_token` resource, this field is no longer valid.

consulSnapshotRetention.description: The retention policy for Consul snapshots.

consulVersion.description: The Consul version of the cluster.

datacenter.description: The Consul data center name of the cluster. If not specified, it is defaulted to the value of `cluster_id`.

hvnId.description: The ID of the HVN this HCP Consul cluster is associated to.

minConsulVersion.description:
The minimum Consul version of the cluster. If not specified, it is defaulted to the version that is currently
recommended by HCP.

organizationId.description: The ID of the organization this HCP Consul cluster is located in.

primaryLink.description:
The `self_link` of the HCP Consul cluster which is the primary in the federation setup with this HCP Consul cluster. If
not specified, it is a standalone cluster.

projectId.description: The ID of the project this HCP Consul cluster is located in.

publicEndpoint.description: Denotes that the cluster has a public endpoint for the Consul UI. Defaults to false.

region.description: The region where the HCP Consul cluster is located.

scale.description: The number of Consul server nodes in the cluster.

selfLink.description: A unique URL identifying the HCP Consul cluster.

size.description:
The t-shirt size representation of each server VM that this Consul cluster is provisioned with. Valid option for
development tier - `x_small`. Valid options for other tiers - `small`, `medium`, `large`. For more details -
https://cloud.hashicorp.com/pricing/consul. Upgrading the size of a cluster after creation is allowed.

tier.description:
The tier that the HCP Consul cluster will be provisioned as. Only `development`, `standard` and `plus` are available at
this time. See [pricing information](https://cloud.hashicorp.com/pricing/consul).

autoHvnToHvnPeering.description:
Enables automatic HVN to HVN peering when creating a secondary cluster in a federation. The alternative to using the
auto-accept feature is to create an [`hcp_hvn_peering_connection`](hvn_peering_connection.md) resource that explicitly
defines the HVN resources that are allowed to communicate with each other.

auditLogConfig.description:
The audit logs configuration for export.
(https://learn.hashicorp.com/tutorials/cloud/vault-metrics-guide#metrics-streaming-configuration)

cloudProvider.description: The provider where the HCP Vault cluster is located.

clusterId.description: The ID of the HCP Vault cluster.

createdAt.description: The time that the Vault cluster was created.

hvnId.description: The ID of the HVN this HCP Vault cluster is associated to.

minVaultVersion.description:
The minimum Vault version to use when creating the cluster. If not specified, it is defaulted to the version that is
currently recommended by HCP.

namespace.description: The name of the customer namespace this HCP Vault cluster is located in.

organizationId.description: The ID of the organization this HCP Vault cluster is located in.

pathsFilters.description:
The performance replication [paths filter](https://learn.hashicorp.com/tutorials/vault/paths-filter). Applies to
performance replication secondaries only and operates in "deny" mode only.

primaryLink.description:
The `self_link` of the HCP Vault Plus tier cluster which is the primary in the performance replication setup with this
HCP Vault Plus tier cluster. If not specified, it is a standalone Plus tier HCP Vault cluster.

projectId.description: The ID of the project this HCP Vault cluster is located in.

publicEndpoint.description: Denotes that the cluster has a public endpoint. Defaults to false.

region.description: The region where the HCP Vault cluster is located.

selfLink.description: A unique URL identifying the Vault cluster.

tier.description:
Tier of the HCP Vault cluster. Valid options for tiers - `dev`, `starter_small`, `standard_small`, `standard_medium`,
`standard_large`, `plus_small`, `plus_medium`, `plus_large`. See [pricing
information](https://cloud.hashicorp.com/pricing/vault).

vaultPrivateEndpointUrl.description: The private URL for the Vault cluster.

vaultPublicEndpointUrl.description: The public URL for the Vault cluster. This will be empty if `public_endpoint` is `false`.

vaultVersion.description: The Vault version of the cluster.

auditLogConfig.description:
The audit logs configuration for export.
(https://learn.hashicorp.com/tutorials/cloud/vault-metrics-guide#metrics-streaming-configuration)

clusterId.description: The ID of the HCP Vault cluster.

hvnId.description: The ID of the HVN this HCP Vault cluster is associated to.

minVaultVersion.description:
The minimum Vault version to use when creating the cluster. If not specified, it is defaulted to the version that is
currently recommended by HCP.

pathsFilters.description:
The performance replication [paths filter](https://learn.hashicorp.com/tutorials/vault/paths-filter). Applies to
performance replication secondaries only and operates in "deny" mode only.

primaryLink.description:
The `self_link` of the HCP Vault Plus tier cluster which is the primary in the performance replication setup with this
HCP Vault Plus tier cluster. If not specified, it is a standalone Plus tier HCP Vault cluster.

publicEndpoint.description: Denotes that the cluster has a public endpoint. Defaults to false.

tier.description:
Tier of the HCP Vault cluster. Valid options for tiers - `dev`, `starter_small`, `standard_small`, `standard_medium`,
`standard_large`, `plus_small`, `plus_medium`, `plus_large`. See [pricing
information](https://cloud.hashicorp.com/pricing/vault).

stateInputs.description: Input properties used for looking up and filtering VaultCluster resources.

auditLogConfig.description:
The audit logs configuration for export.
(https://learn.hashicorp.com/tutorials/cloud/vault-metrics-guide#metrics-streaming-configuration)

cloudProvider.description: The provider where the HCP Vault cluster is located.

clusterId.description: The ID of the HCP Vault cluster.

createdAt.description: The time that the Vault cluster was created.

hvnId.description: The ID of the HVN this HCP Vault cluster is associated to.

minVaultVersion.description:
The minimum Vault version to use when creating the cluster. If not specified, it is defaulted to the version that is
currently recommended by HCP.

namespace.description: The name of the customer namespace this HCP Vault cluster is located in.

organizationId.description: The ID of the organization this HCP Vault cluster is located in.

pathsFilters.description:
The performance replication [paths filter](https://learn.hashicorp.com/tutorials/vault/paths-filter). Applies to
performance replication secondaries only and operates in "deny" mode only.

primaryLink.description:
The `self_link` of the HCP Vault Plus tier cluster which is the primary in the performance replication setup with this
HCP Vault Plus tier cluster. If not specified, it is a standalone Plus tier HCP Vault cluster.

projectId.description: The ID of the project this HCP Vault cluster is located in.

publicEndpoint.description: Denotes that the cluster has a public endpoint. Defaults to false.

region.description: The region where the HCP Vault cluster is located.

selfLink.description: A unique URL identifying the Vault cluster.

tier.description:
Tier of the HCP Vault cluster. Valid options for tiers - `dev`, `starter_small`, `standard_small`, `standard_medium`,
`standard_large`, `plus_small`, `plus_medium`, `plus_large`. See [pricing
information](https://cloud.hashicorp.com/pricing/vault).

vaultPrivateEndpointUrl.description: The private URL for the Vault cluster.

vaultPublicEndpointUrl.description: The public URL for the Vault cluster. This will be empty if `public_endpoint` is `false`.

vaultVersion.description: The Vault version of the cluster.

clusterId.description: The ID of the HCP Vault cluster.

createdAt.description: The time that the admin token was created.

token.description: The admin token of this HCP Vault cluster.

clusterId.description: The ID of the HCP Vault cluster.

stateInputs.description: Input properties used for looking up and filtering VaultClusterAdminToken resources.

clusterId.description: The ID of the HCP Vault cluster.

createdAt.description: The time that the admin token was created.

token.description: The admin token of this HCP Vault cluster.
